meanings.definition: Given to or involved in conspiring to do something immoral, illegal, or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The conniving villain plotted to steal the treasure from the museum.
meanings.sent2: She knew her conniving neighbor was up to no good.
meanings.sent3: The conniving character in the movie always had a sneaky plan.
meanings.sent4: His conniving behavior was like a shadow lurking in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The conniving fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.

meanings.definition: Secretly allow (something considered immoral, illegal, wrong, or harmful) to occur.
meanings.sent1: He connivingly let his friends cheat during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt official connived with criminals to embezzle funds.
meanings.sent3: The conniving student slyly watched as others copied his answers.
meanings.sent4: The storm connived with the darkness to create chaos in the city.
meanings.sent5: The conniving silence of the night masked the sounds of the crime.
